p: A diagnosis of syphilis in humans and animal models is typically characterized by elevations in both plasma pro-inflammatory (TNFα, IFNγ, CCL4, IP-10) and anti-inflammatory cytokines (IL-10) [ 11– 18]. This immunological profile however varies according to a number of parameters including stage of syphilis [ 4, 17– 20], HIV-infection status [ 20] and the number of previous episodes of syphilis [ 4, 21, 22]. Our study is the first that we are aware of that has been able to assess the immune profile of the same individuals at the time of reinfection.
